articles.title: ProShares S&P 500 Dynamic Buffer ETF (FB) Stock Price, Holdings, Dividend Yield
articles.summary: This article provides a detailed overview of the ProShares S&P 500 Dynamic Buffer ETF (FB), including its current stock price, dividend yield, and key holdings as of August 31, 2025. It highlights the ETF's top five holdings, which include NVIDIA, Microsoft, Apple, Amazon, and Meta Platforms, and also presents various performance metrics and fundamental data.

articles.title: iShares MSCI World ETF: Tech-Riesen im Fokus
articles.summary: The iShares MSCI World ETF is heavily concentrated in tech stocks, with its top 10 positions comprising over 25% of the fund's volume, including giants like NVIDIA, Microsoft, and Apple. Despite recent market fluctuations, the ETF has seen an 11% increase year-to-date and continued inflows, indicating investor confidence in developed markets. However, this tech focus also makes the ETF vulnerable to sector-specific setbacks.

articles.title: QQQI ETF: 13.7% Yield and 30% NAV Growth Outshine QYLD, JEPQ
articles.summary: The NEOS Nasdaq-100 High Income ETF (QQQI) has demonstrated superior performance since its January 2024 launch, offering a 13.78% trailing twelve-month yield and 30.52% NAV growth. QQQI differentiates itself from competitors like JEPQ and QYLD through a tax-efficient strategy involving selective covered calls and reinvestment of option premiums, allowing for both consistent income and capital appreciation. The ETF's heavy tech concentration, coupled with its ability to capitalize on market volatility and Section 1256 tax treatment, makes it an attractive "Buy" for income-seeking investors amidst elevated market valuations.

articles.title: The calculator company that’s also a semiconductor giant
articles.summary: Texas Instruments (TI), widely known for its graphing calculators, is also a significant player in the semiconductor industry. The company, co-inventor of the integrated circuit, now primarily focuses on analog and embedded semiconductors used in various applications from cars to healthcare. TI is making massive investments, including a $60 billion plan to build new fabrication plants in Texas and Utah, and is partnering with Nvidia for AI infrastructure.

articles.title: Should You Buy the Low-Cost ETF With 62% Invested in "Ten Titans" Growth Stocks?
articles.summary: This article examines the Invesco S&P 500 Top 50 ETF (XLG), which has a significant 62% allocation to "Ten Titans" growth stocks, an expansion of the "Magnificent Seven" that includes Broadcom, Oracle, and Netflix. The ETF offers concentrated exposure to mega-cap growth companies, outperforming other funds due to this focus, despite slightly higher expense ratios. Investors seeking to maximize exposure to these dominant growth stocks may find XLG a worthwhile choice, though it carries increased volatility due to its concentrated nature.

articles.title: Richtech Robotics Inc. Launches New $100M ATM Offering
articles.summary: Richtech Robotics Inc. has launched a new "At The Market" (ATM) offering, allowing it to sell up to $100 million in Class B common stock. This agreement, effective August 28, 2025, replaces a previous one and designates Rodman & Renshaw LLC and H.C. Wainwright & Co., LLC as agents, with Rodman serving as the exclusive sales agent for 12 months from May 16, 2025. The company's Class B stock (RR) currently holds a "Buy" rating from analysts with a target price of $3.00.

articles.title: Eaton Vance Fund Appoints New Chairperson
articles.summary: Eaton Vance Tax-Managed Global Buy-Write Opportunities Fund (ETW) has announced the appointment of Scott E. Wennerholm as its new Chairperson. Wennerholm will serve a four-year term, succeeding interim leader Susan J. Sutherland. This appointment comes after the passing of the former Chairperson.

articles.title: Agilent Technologies, Nvidia, Snowflake
articles.summary: This article details revised ratings and price targets from Wall Street securities analysts for various US-listed companies, including Agilent Technologies, Nvidia, and Snowflake. Key highlights show increased price targets for Nvidia and Snowflake, reflecting positive analyst sentiment. The report provides a comprehensive list of these revisions, offering insights into recent analyst actions across diverse sectors.

articles.title: ProShares Debuts 2x Daily ETF for Equal Weight S&P 500
articles.summary: ProShares has launched the ProShares Ultra S&P 500 Equal Weight ETF (URSP), offering 2x daily leveraged exposure to the S&P 500 Equal Weight Index. This new ETF aims to provide even exposure across companies within the S&P 500, contrasting with traditional cap-weighted approaches. URSP will invest in derivatives and equity securities, rebalancing daily to track the index's performance.

articles.title: Nvidia Earnings Live: Results Come in Slightly Above Wall Street Expectations; Stock Slips in Extended Trading
articles.summary: Nvidia reported Q2 results slightly above Wall Street expectations, with revenue soaring 56% to a record $46.7 billion, but data center revenue and lower-end guidance for the current quarter fell short of estimates, leading to a 3% stock dip in after-hours trading. Investors are closely watching CEO Jensen Huang's comments on the company's outlook, China business, and next-generation product pipeline, particularly the forthcoming Rubin platform and the potential $50 billion China market opportunity. Despite these mixed results and ongoing China trade policy headwinds, analysts remain overwhelmingly bullish on Nvidia's long-term prospects due to strong AI demand.

articles.title: Beamr Imaging Ltd. to Showcase Advanced Video Compression Solution for Autonomous Vehicles at IAA Mobility 2025
articles.summary: Beamr Imaging Ltd. announced it will showcase its advanced video compression solution for autonomous vehicles (AV) at IAA Mobility 2025, from September 9-12 in Munich. The technology, validated by NVIDIA, significantly improves compression efficiency by 23% to 50% compared to existing machine learning workflows, reducing operational costs and enhancing development cycles for AV companies managing large datasets. Beamr's Content-Adaptive Bitrate (CABR) technology optimizes video quality while preserving crucial visual cues for AV models, addressing critical infrastructure challenges.

articles.title: Nutanix Reports Fourth Quarter and Fiscal 2025 Financial Results
articles.summary: Nutanix, Inc. reported strong financial results for its fourth quarter and fiscal year ended July 31, 2025, with 18% year-over-year revenue growth and substantial free cash flow. The company added over 2,700 new customers and strengthened partnerships with AWS, Pure Storage, NVIDIA, and Google, while innovating its cloud platform. Nutanix also provided an optimistic outlook for the first quarter and full fiscal year 2026.

articles.title: CHAT and SOXX: The 2 Growth ETFs That Could Outperform VOO Over the Next Decade
articles.summary: This article highlights two technology-centered growth ETFs, CHAT and SOXX, as potential outperformers against the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOO) over the next decade. CHAT focuses on AI-forward companies, boasting significant returns despite higher fees, while SOXX provides strong exposure to the semiconductor industry, showing superior long-term growth compared to VOO. Both ETFs offer concentrated investments in rapidly expanding sectors, positioning them for substantial future growth.

articles.title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Second Quarter Fiscal 2026
articles.summary: NVIDIA reported strong second-quarter fiscal 2026 results with revenue of $46.7 billion, up 56% year-over-year, driven by record Data Center revenue of $41.1 billion. The company's Blackwell Data Center revenue significantly grew, and NVIDIA announced a new $60 billion share repurchase authorization. NVIDIA also provided an optimistic outlook for the third quarter, projecting revenue of $54.0 billion.

articles.title: Aehr Test Systems Announces Wafer Level Burn-in and Test Application Evaluation Order from Leading AI Processor Supplier
articles.summary: Aehr Test Systems (NASDAQ: AEHR) received a purchase order from a leading AI processor supplier for a wafer level burn-in (WLBI) application evaluation. This paid evaluation includes a custom WaferPak high-power fine-pitch 300mm wafer contactor and production WLBI test program development, aiming to validate Aehr's FOX-XP production systems for high-performance AI processors. The evaluation program, expected to take three to six months, will compare WLBI with traditional package-level burn-in to demonstrate cost savings and improved yield by identifying failures earlier in the manufacturing process.

articles.title: Broadcom Inc. Partners with NVIDIA to Integrate Advanced AI Technology into VMware Cloud Foundation
articles.summary: Broadcom Inc. announced a partnership with NVIDIA to integrate advanced AI technology, including NVIDIA Blackwell GPU architecture and high-speed networking, into VMware Cloud Foundation (VCF). This collaboration aims to empower enterprises and cloud providers to scale AI model development in private clouds while preserving VCF's operational reliability. Key benefits include support for latest GPUs and networking, enabling efficient processing of generative and physical AI applications, all while maintaining core VCF functionalities such as vMotion and High Availability.

articles.title: NYSEARCA:VUG ETF Climbs to $460 Near Record Highs on AI Growth and Earnings
articles.summary: The Vanguard Growth Index Fund ETF (NYSEARCA:VUG) is trading near its all-time highs at $460, driven by the strong performance of mega-cap technology stocks, particularly those benefiting from AI and cloud expansion. The ETF's outperformance is attributed to robust earnings from its top holdings like Nvidia, Microsoft, and Alphabet, with a forecast of further upside supported by anticipated Fed rate cuts and continued economic growth. While its concentration in a few large names presents a risk, VUG's low expense ratio and historical returns make it a compelling allocation for long-term growth investors.

articles.title: Shelton Capital To Launch SEPI ETF, Betting On Options-Income Boom
articles.summary: Shelton Capital Management is launching the Shelton Equity Premium Income ETF (SEPI) on September 8th, entering the growing options-income ETF market. Unlike many competitors, SEPI will use an active strategy of selling covered calls on individual big-cap stocks to balance income generation and upside potential. This new ETF aims to attract income investors with its blend of option premiums and dividend distributions, capitalizing on the increasing popularity of actively managed derivative-income strategies.

articles.title: NVDA Earnings, AI Hype, and Cybersecurity Trends
articles.summary: This article discusses key technology trends, including NVIDIA's upcoming earnings, the ongoing AI hype, and the growing importance of cybersecurity. It features insights from Ivana Delevska of Spear Invest, manager of the Spear Alpha ETF (SPRX), highlighting investments in AI, cybersecurity, and space technologies. The article touches on investor concerns about an AI bubble and the challenges of investing in the nascent space sector.

articles.title: NVDA Earnings, AI Hype, and Cybersecurity Trends
articles.summary: This article discusses key technology trends including NVIDIA's upcoming earnings, the ongoing hype around AI, and the growing importance of cybersecurity. It also touches on investment opportunities in space technology through the Spear Alpha ETF (SPRX). The ETF focuses on breakthrough industrial technologies, with top holdings like NVIDIA and Palo Alto Networks.

articles.title: Gaming Giant GCL Acquires 30-Year Tech Distribution Powerhouse Ban Leong Technologies in Asia Push
articles.summary: GCL Global Holdings (NASDAQ: GCL) has completed the compulsory acquisition of Ban Leong Technologies Limited through its subsidiary Epicsoft Asia, leading to Ban Leong's delisting from the Singapore Stock Exchange on August 26, 2025. This acquisition integrates Ban Leong's extensive technology distribution network across Asia, including partnerships with over 50 global brands, into GCL's gaming ecosystem. The move aims to create significant synergies, new revenue streams through gaming hardware and content, and expands GCL's market presence in crucial Asian markets.

articles.title: NVDA Earnings, AI Hype, and Cybersecurity Trends
articles.summary: This article discusses key market events including NVIDIA's upcoming earnings, the ongoing AI hype, and the growing importance of cybersecurity in the age of artificial intelligence. It features insights from Ivana Delevska of Spear Invest on investing in innovative technologies through the Spear Alpha ETF (SPRX). The piece also touches on challenges and opportunities in the space sector.

articles.title: NVIDIA Blackwell-Powered Jetson Thor Now Available, Accelerating the Age of General Robotics
articles.summary: NVIDIA has announced the general availability of its NVIDIA Jetson AGX Thor developer kit and production modules, designed to power advanced robotics and physical AI. Powered by Blackwell GPUs, Jetson Thor delivers significantly higher AI compute and energy efficiency than its predecessor, enabling robots to have real-time, intelligent interactions. Industry leaders like Agility Robotics, Amazon Robotics, Boston Dynamics, and Figure are among the early adopters, praising its capabilities for running powerful AI models at the edge.

articles.title: Tesla’s Stock Is in Trouble, but This Fund Manager Sees a Comeback in 2026
articles.summary: Despite Tesla's stock being down 19.8% in 2025 due to declining sales and CEO Elon Musk's controversies, fund manager Joe Dennison of Virtus Zevenbergen Innovative Growth Stock Fund expects a comeback in 2026. Dennison believes the increasing role of autonomous vehicles, AI, new affordable models, and Tesla's strong fundamentals will drive its recovery. The fund has owned Tesla shares since shortly after its 2010 IPO and views it as a leader in AI, robotics, and sustainable energy, not just a car company.

articles.title: Lambda Builds AI Factories with Supermicro NVIDIA Blackwell GPU Server Clusters to Deliver Production-ready Next-Gen AI Infrastructure at Scale
articles.summary: Super Micro Computer, Inc. announced that Lambda has deployed a broad portfolio of Supermicro GPU-optimized servers, including NVIDIA Blackwell based systems, to expand its AI infrastructure and deliver high-performance systems to customers. This collaboration aims to build large-scale AI factories for training and inference, utilizing Supermicro's advanced liquid-cooling for energy efficiency. The initiative, first launched in Columbus, Ohio, provides enterprise-grade AI compute solutions to the Midwest region.

articles.title: US to take 10% equity stake in Intel, in Trump's latest corporate move
articles.summary: The U.S. government, under President Donald Trump, will acquire a 9.9% equity stake in Intel for $8.9 billion, converting government grants from the CHIPS Act and the Secure Enclave program into an ownership share. This move, aiming to bolster Intel's struggling foundry business and ensure domestic chip production, reflects a growing trend of unusual government intervention in corporate America. The deal comes after previous tensions between Trump and Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan, and analysts question if the cash infusion will be enough to help Intel catch up to competitors like TSMC and Nvidia.

articles.title: Intel agrees to give US government $8.9B stake in its company
articles.summary: Intel has agreed to sell an $8.9 billion stake in its company to the U.S. government, with nearly $6 billion funded by previously awarded CHIPS and Science Act grants. This move, championed by President Trump, aims to boost U.S. chip manufacturing and reflects Intel's current financial struggles and need for capital. The deal has drawn criticism from some U.S. Senators who view it as corporate extortion.

articles.title: Enterprise storage driven by HPE and Nvidia partnership
articles.summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise Co. and Nvidia Corp. have expanded their partnership to focus on AI-optimized storage, aiming to reshape enterprise storage for the evolving AI world. This collaboration introduces data intelligence into the storage platform, enabling context-rich, AI-ready data integration and enhancing object storage capabilities for AI workloads. The initiative also seeks to drive operational efficiency with remote direct memory access transfers, significantly boosting performance for AI applications.

articles.title: RETRANSMISSION: Check-Cap and MBody AI Advance Toward Closing Transformational Merger
articles.summary: Check-Cap Ltd. and MBody AI are progressing toward finalizing their merger, with Check-Cap rescheduling its Annual General Meeting to November 14, 2025, to approve the merger, a reverse stock split, director elections, and a name change to MBody AI Ltd. MBody AI has experienced significant growth and investor interest since the initial announcement, bolstering its valuation and positioning the combined entity as a leader in embodied AI. This merger aims to provide Check-Cap shareholders with access to a high-growth market opportunity in embodied AI, a technology projected to drive substantial economic impact.

articles.title: US government announces 10% stake in chipmaker Intel
articles.summary: The US government has announced it will take a 10% stake in chipmaker Intel, an investment of $8.9 billion from previously awarded grants under the CHIPS and Science Act. This move aims to strengthen US leadership in semiconductors and secure America's technological edge, particularly as Intel has struggled against rivals like Nvidia and faced scrutiny over its CEO's alleged ties to China. The deal is considered rare but has historical parallels and is seen as a "creative idea" to advance US economic and national security objectives.

articles.title: HPE Stock Surges Amidst AI Advancements
articles.summary: Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) stock surged by 3.49% due to strategic advancements in AI, including new servers with NVIDIA GPUs and partnerships like the one with Subaru for AI-driven automotive safety. Deutsche Bank increased its price target for HPE shares to $26, boosted by the Juniper acquisition and a substantial UK court ruling awarding HPE $944M. The company's focus on AI and strategic collaborations positions it for potential future growth despite recent mixed financial results.

articles.title: This Insider Has Just Sold Shares In Mueller Water Products
articles.summary: An Independent Director at Mueller Water Products, Thomas Hansen, recently sold US$628k worth of shares, reducing his holding by 23%. This sale follows a larger sale by a Senior Advisor last year for US$2.2m. While insiders have been selling, there have been no insider buys in the past year, which the article suggests makes caution advisable despite the company's earnings growth.

articles.title: Newegg Announces First Half 2025 Results
articles.summary: Newegg Commerce, Inc. announced strong first-half 2025 results, with net sales increasing by 12.6% to $695.7 million and GMV growing by 13.7% to $849.1 million. The growth was primarily driven by high demand for GPUs and other PC components, including new product launches from NVIDIA and AMD, and strategic cost optimization measures led to a significant improvement in adjusted EBITDA to $11.3 million. The company plans future launches including an expansion of its ABS line of PCs and the debut of a Gamer Community and Gamer Zone.

articles.title: What’s Happening With Applied Materials Stock?
articles.summary: Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT) saw a 15% stock drop despite better-than-expected Q3 results due to weak Q4 guidance and concerns over future demand from China. Geopolitical factors and fluctuating demand across semiconductor segments are impacting the company, though it is well-positioned to benefit from the generative AI boom due to its advanced equipment technologies and investments. The stock trades at 17x forward earnings, with long-term growth prospects appearing strong despite muted short-term forecasts.

articles.title: Tuesday was a key day, as momentum plays flopped while value stocks rallied. But was it a shift or a blip?
articles.summary: Tuesday witnessed a significant market shift where value stocks outperformed momentum plays, marking one of the largest such reversals in a year. Popular momentum stocks like Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices, Oracle, and Palantir struggled, while the iShares MSCI USA Value Factor ETF saw a substantial gain relative to its momentum counterpart. The market reacted not so much to overall index movement, but to this underlying change in investment trends.

articles.title: Roper Technologies Move Higher – (ROP) Stock Initiated at Buy, As AI Threat Shrugged Off
articles.summary: Roper Technologies (ROP) stock has been initiated with a 'Buy' rating and a $626 price target by Citi, leading to a surge in sentiment. Citi believes Roper's "more subtle" evolution in operational and capital allocation strategies, combined with its strong position in leveraging AI due to vertical-specific data and a decentralized model, has been overlooked by markets. This positive outlook is further supported by strong Q2 2025 financial results, including a 13% revenue increase, and the strategic acquisition of Subsplash.

articles.title: Reddit Inc Class A (RDDT) Has a New Rating from Argus Research
articles.summary: Argus Research initiated coverage of Reddit Inc Class A (RDDT) with a Buy rating and a $250.00 price target, following the company's shares closing at $246.50. This new rating contributes to an analyst consensus of Moderate Buy for RDDT, despite a consensus price target of $200.29, which suggests a potential downside from current levels. Citi also recently maintained a Buy rating with a $220.00 price target.

articles.title: Nvidia's Upcoming Earnings Report Puts Direxion's NVDA-Focused Bull And Bear Funds In The Limelight
articles.summary: Nvidia's upcoming second-quarter earnings report on August 27th is highly anticipated due to the company's strong performance in AI, but also faces exceptionally high expectations. Direxion offers two ETFs, Direxion Daily NVDA Bull 2X Shares (NVDU) and Direxion Daily NVDA Bear 1X Shares (NVDD), that allow traders to bet on Nvidia's stock movement without using options, though they carry unique risks like increased volatility and potential value decay if held longer than one day. Analysts have varying outlooks, with some maintaining a "Buy" rating and a price target of $220, despite concerns about Nvidia's high price-to-sales ratio and near-term volatility.

articles.title: Sales and profits up again at Fabrinet
articles.summary: Fabrinet, a Thailand-headquartered contract manufacturer of optical devices, reported record-breaking annual sales of $3.4 billion, up 19% year-on-year, driven by strong demand from AI data center investments and new deals including Amazon Web Services. Despite this growth and increased profits, the company's stock dropped 10% due to warnings of temporary supply constraints impacting shipments of new 1.6 Tb/s optical transceivers. The CEO, Seamus Grady, highlighted robust customer demand and ongoing expansion efforts, while also noting no meaningful impact from US trade tariffs.

articles.title: Can Plasma Technology Adoption Redefine Constellium’s (CSTM) Competitive Edge in Low-Carbon Aluminum?
articles.summary: Constellium is adopting plasma torch technology in aluminum remelting in partnership with PyroGenesis Inc. to reduce emissions and improve energy efficiency, supporting its low-carbon aluminum strategy. While this technological advancement could enhance Constellium's long-term competitive edge, its near-term financial performance remains heavily influenced by demand stabilization in the automotive and aerospace sectors. The company's Q2 2025 results showed higher sales but sharply lower net income, highlighting the current pressure on earnings despite innovation efforts.

articles.title: Is Nvidia a Republican or a Democrat? These political ETFs have voted.
articles.summary: This article explores the political affiliation of Nvidia, a leading AI company, through the lens of politically focused ETFs. It highlights that Nvidia is a significant holding in both the Unusual Whales Subversive Republican Trading ETF (GOP) and the American Conservative Values ETF (ACVF). The author suggests that such politically oriented ETFs, which tap into polarized views, demonstrate the pitfalls of mixing investing with partisan politics.

articles.title: Is Nvidia a Republican or a Democrat? These political ETFs have voted.
articles.summary: This article explores how politically-focused ETFs characterize Nvidia. It notes that Nvidia, a leader in AI, is a significant holding in both the Unusual Whales Subversive Republican Trading ETF and the American Conservative Values ETF. The author questions the efficacy of mixing investing with partisan politics, suggesting these ETFs may not be a sound investment strategy.

articles.title: Aehr Test Systems to Participate in the Needham Virtual Semiconductor and SemiCap 1×1 Conference on August 20
articles.summary: Aehr Test Systems announced its participation in the 6th Annual Needham Virtual Semiconductor and SemiCap 1x1 Conference on August 20, 2025. President and CEO Gayn Erickson and CFO Chris Siu will host virtual meetings with investors to discuss their wafer-level test and packaged part burn-in solutions, including their new high-power reliability/burn-in test solutions for the AI semiconductor market. The company aims to highlight its growth drivers in electric vehicles, 5G, data centers, and AI processors.

articles.title: Marvell Technology: Be Greedy When Others Are Fearful (NASDAQ:MRVL)
articles.summary: Marvell Technology experienced an 18.6% stock drop following a weaker-than-expected Q2'26 earnings report, but this is seen as an overreaction. The company posted strong 58% Y/Y revenue growth in Q2'26 and a robust outlook for Q3, positioning it favorably within the AI and Data Center CapEx landscape. The stock is currently trading at a discount, offering an attractive entry point for investors seeking AI-driven growth.

articles.title: This ETF Streamlines AI Investing
articles.summary: The Invesco Top QQQ ETF (QBIG) offers an efficient way to invest in mega-cap artificial intelligence stocks, holding key companies like the "Magnificent Seven" and Broadcom. Despite its concentrated portfolio, QBIG covers various AI segments, allowing investors to capitalize on the sector's growth without individual stock picking. This approach helps mitigate risks associated with the evolving and often complex AI investment landscape.

articles.title: Agilent Technologies, Nvidia, Snowflake
articles.summary: This article details various Wall Street securities analysts' revisions to ratings and price targets for numerous US-listed companies, including Agilent Technologies, Nvidia, and Snowflake. It highlights significant target increases for companies like Nvidia and Snowflake, alongside decreases and new initiations for others. The report provides a comprehensive list of these adjustments, covering a wide range of industries.

articles.title: Nvidia Isn't the Only Way to Profit From the AI Boom
articles.summary: While Nvidia has shown incredible growth and dominates the AI chip market, its stock is highly priced for perfection, requiring flawless performance each quarter. For investors seeking broad exposure to the AI boom without over-reliance on a single company, the Invesco PHLX Semiconductor ETF (SOXQ) offers diversification across 30 major semiconductor companies, including Nvidia, at a lower expense ratio. The insatiable demand for advanced semiconductors suggests the entire sector is a promising investment avenue, with many companies demonstrating strong performance and more attractive valuations than Nvidia.

articles.title: Could O'Reilly Automotive's (ORLY) Aggressive Buybacks Signal Enduring Confidence or Missed Investment Alternatives?
articles.summary: O'Reilly Automotive's (ORLY) stock recently hit an all-time high, driven by an aggressive share repurchase program that has reduced outstanding shares by 24% since 2020 and management's optimistic outlook for future sales and profit margins. While buybacks reinforce investor confidence, the article highlights the ongoing risk of increased tariffs and supply chain disruptions potentially impacting product costs and gross margins. Analysts' fair value estimates for ORLY show significant divergence, reflecting varying perspectives on these risks and future performance.

articles.title: Super Micro Computer, Inc. (SMCI) Up 7.4% Since Jim Cramer Said “I’m Not A Beleiver”
articles.summary: Super Micro Computer, Inc. (SMCI) has seen its stock rise 7.4% since Jim Cramer expressed skepticism about the company. Despite an initial cratering and a prior auditor resignation due to accounting impropriety allegations, SMCI's shares surged following an announcement about offering NVIDIA's Blackwell products and assurances regarding its earnings report filing. Cramer acknowledged SMCI's potential but highlighted concerns about its accounting practices, suggesting other AI stocks might offer better returns with less risk.

articles.title: Advanced Micro Devices, Inc. (AMD)’s Shares Are An Example Of Volatility Since Cramer Said It Was Okay To Buy
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) shares have experienced significant volatility despite Jim Cramer's earlier endorsement. After initial gains, the stock saw a substantial drop, only to rebound strongly, driven by increasing AI bullishness and the belief in AMD's growing role in the AI chip market. Cramer reiterated his positive outlook on the company, citing strong products and leadership.
